alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 10:52AM EST until March 02 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. .No significant precipitation is expected for the next several days so river levels are expected to slowly fall. For the Grand River...including Comstock Park...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Abrigador Trail is underwater and minor flooding of homes occurs along Abrigador Trail and Willow Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:09 PM EST Saturday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:09 PM EST Saturday was 13.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning and continue falling to 9.4 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 04/27/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
